We invite you to join us as we celebrate the beginning of our happily ever after.

From England and New Zealand, our journey has been filled with laughter, adventure, tears, and unforgettable memories. Together, we've built a beautiful life, and now, with our little one Freddy by our side, we're thrilled to begin this exciting new chapter!

It would mean the world to us to have you join in the celebration as we say "I do" and embark on our forever together.

Our Schedule

29th August 2025

Lake Vouliagmeni

The Welcome Party: Join us for an evening of traditional live music and local food at the stunning Lake Vouliagmeni.

Location Lake Vouliagmeni, Vouliagmeni, 166 71, Greece
Travel Accessible by taxi, car, with on-site parking.
Dress Code Smart casual attire
Begins at 7:00 PM
Concludes at 12:30 AM

30th August 2025

Ktima48

The Wedding: Celebrate with us at the beautiful Ktima48 for our wedding ceremony, followed by an evening of dinner and festivities.

Location Ktima 48.7 km, Leof. Athinon Souniou 48, Anavissos 190 13, Greece
Coach Pickup 6:00 PM at Faneromeni Church, Vouliagmeni
Dress Code Formal Attire/Black Tie Optional
Ceremony at 7:00 PM
Coach Return Coaches will depart back to Faneromeni Church at 1:00 AM and 3:00 AM

Transportation Information

Friday, August 29th

Lake Vouliagmeni is easily accessible by taxi or car, with plenty of parking available on-site. It‚Äôs also just a 15-minute walk from the center of Vouliagmeni, though we recommend pre-booking a taxi for peace of mind, allowing you to fully enjoy the celebration!

Saturday, August 30th

Please note that there is no parking available at Ktima48. However, we have arranged for coaches to depart from Faneromeni Church in Vouliagmeni at 6:00 PM, transporting guests to the venue with return trips later in the evening. Coaches will return to Panagia Faneromeni Church at 1:00 AM and 3:00 AM.

Taxis may be difficult to find at the venue unless pre-booked. If you prefer not to use the coach service, please ensure that transportation is arranged in advance.

Local Taxi Companies

Uber (app)
Freenow (app)
Radiotaxi Glyfadas at +30 210 960 5600

In Greece, Uber & Freenow partners with the official licensed yellow taxis offering a reliable way to book rides.

Accommodation Recommendations

For your convenience, we recommend staying in the picturesque area of Vouliagmeni, known for its beaches, bars, and excellent restaurants. It‚Äôs just a short 30-minute taxi to central Athens, where you can explore the Parthenon and other historic landmarks. The venue for the Friday event is conveniently situated in Vouliagmeni, and our wedding on Saturday is just a 25-minute drive away.

Below is a list of recommended hotels in the area. Use the code 'natalie&frazer' for a special discount when booking directly with the hotel, or check online for potentially lower rates.

What to do in Athens

While you're here, explore Athens' rich history, charm, and nearby gems‚Äîthere's so much to discover!

Parthenon

The Acropolis is a symbol of ancient Greece, with the Parthenon at its heart, representing Greek democracy and civilization. It's open daily from 8:00 AM to sunset. To avoid long lines, it's recommended to book tickets online in advance at acropolisticket.com. Located at Dionysiou Areopagitou Street, Athens.

Acropolis Museum

Explore the archaeological finds from the Acropolis site. The museum‚Äôs glass floors offer a direct view of ongoing excavations. Open daily, located at Dionysiou Areopagitou 15, Athens.

National Archaeological Museum

Home to some of the most significant artifacts from Greece‚Äôs history, from prehistory to antiquity. Open Tuesday-Sunday, 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM. Located at 44 Patission Street, Athens.

Panathenaic Stadium

This historic stadium, built entirely of marble, is the site of the first modern Olympic Games in 1896. It‚Äôs open daily from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM, offering a chance to explore its history and impressive structure. Located at Kallimarmaro, Athens.

Odeon of Herodes Atticus (Outdoor Theatre)

The Odeon of Herodes Atticus is a stunning ancient theater located on the southwest slope of the Acropolis. It hosts a variety of performances, including concerts and theater productions, especially during the Athens Festival in the summer. Check local listings for show times and ticket information.

Museum of Cycladic Art

Focused on ancient Aegean and Cypriot cultures, particularly Cycladic Art from the 3rd millennium BC. Open daily, located at 4 Neophytou Douka Str., Athens.

Byzantine & Christian Museum

Explore over 25,000 artifacts from the Early Christian to the Medieval periods. Open daily, located at 22 Vas. Sofias Ave., Athens.

Ancient Agora

A central part of Athens' political, commercial, and social life in antiquity. Located at 24 Adrianou Str., Athens.

Temple of Olympian Zeus

A colossal ruined temple dedicated to Zeus, located near the Acropolis. Included in the Acropolis ticket.

National Garden

A peaceful park in central Athens with ancient ruins and tranquil paths. Located next to Syntagma Square.

Syntagma Square

Athens‚Äô bustling heart, surrounded by grand buildings and the Greek Parliament. A must-see for a feel of modern Athens.

Plaka, Thissio, and Anafiotika

Wander through the charming historical districts with neoclassical homes, cafes, and shops.

Lycabettus Mountain

Enjoy stunning views from Athens' highest point. Reach it by foot or funicular for an unforgettable experience. Open daily, located at Ploutarchou 1, Athens.

Stavros Niarchos Cultural Center

A cultural and recreational hub with free access to events, a national opera, and the beautiful Stavros Niarchos Park. Located at Syggrou Avenue 364, Kallithea.

Glyfada & Flisvos Marina

Explore Glyfada‚Äôs shopping and dining scene, and enjoy the luxury marina with sea views.

Sightseeing Tours

Hop on the Happy Train for a 60-minute sightseeing tour or take the City Sightseeing Bus for a 90-minute tour of Athens' major sights.

See Athens on a Segway

For a fun and efficient way to explore Athens, take a Segway tour around the city's iconic landmarks. We did it and loved it! We highly recommend this company: Ancient Athens City Segway Tour. It‚Äôsa fantastic way to see the city from a unique perspective!

Beach Clubs

Astir Beach Club - A luxurious beach club in Vouliagmeni offering private cabanas, gourmet dining, and crystal-clear waters.

Bolivar Beach Bar - Located in Alimos, this lively spot features beachfront parties and renowned DJs.

Macaw Beach Bar - A tropical oasis in Alimos, known for its laid-back vibe, sunbeds, and cocktails.

Zen Beach Club - A serene beach club in Vouliagmeni offering fully serviced sunbeds and a spacious open area.

Krabo Seaside Dining - A chic beach club in Vouliagmeni, offering beachfront dining with stunning views of the Astir peninsula.

Excursions

Delphi: Explore this UNESCO World Heritage site, home to the Temple of Apollo and a charming town.

Spetses Island: A car-free island with sea taxis, picturesque views, and a serene atmosphere.

Cape Sounion & Temple of Poseidon: Visit the stunning ancient ruins and enjoy breathtaking sunset views, just 63 km from Athens.

Hydra Island: A peaceful, car-free island perfect for a relaxing getaway with its stone mansions and scenic beauty.

Aegina Island: A short boat ride from Athens, famous for pistachios and the Temple of Athena Aphaia.

Poros Island: Known for its lush pine trees and beautiful beaches, Poros is a quiet escape just a short boat ride from Athens.

Nafplio: A picturesque coastal town filled with history, charming streets, and stunning views, located about 2 hours from Athens.
